TheWord.ScriptureReference: Job 32:19, Proverbs 3:10, Isaiah 30:14, Jeremiah 2:20, Jeremiah 5:5, Jeremiah 30:8, Nahum 1:13, Mark 2:22, Luke 5:37, Acts 1:18, Genesis 15:14, 2 Chronicles 8, Ezekiel 13, Revelation 2:10
TheWord.Title: Don't start bursting until noon.

Remember.Commentary: International House of Pancakes (IHOP), Union City. Paul an Albanian is the waiter. Paul's female friend is an Iranian Persia.

BibleWord.Commentary: Behold, my belly is as wine which has no vent; it is ready to burst like new bottles (Job 32:19). So shall your barns be filled with plenty, and your presses shall burst out with new wine (Proverbs 3:10). He shall break it as the breaking of the potters' vessel that is broken in pieces; he shall not spare: so that there shall not be found in the bursting of it a sherd to take fire from the hearth, or to take water withal out of the pit (Isaiah 30:14). For of old time I have broken your yoke, and burst your bands; and you said, I will not transgress; when upon every high hill and under every green tree you wander, playing the harlot (Jeremiah 2:20). I will get me unto the great men, and will speak unto them; for they have known the way of the LORD, and the judgment of their God: but these have altogether broken the yoke, and burst the bonds (Jeremiah 5:5). For it shall come to pass in that day, said the LORD of hosts, that I will break his yoke from off your neck, and will burst your bonds, and strangers shall no more serve themselves of him (Jeremiah 30:8). For now will I break his yoke from off you, and will burst your bonds in sunder (Nahum 1:13). No man puts new wine into old bottles: else the new wine does burst the bottles, and the wine is spilled, and the bottles will be marred: but new wine must be put into new bottles (Mark 2:22). No man puts new wine into old bottles; else the new wine will burst the bottles, and be spilled, and the bottles shall perish (Luke 5:37). Now this man purchased a field with the reward of iniquity; and falling headlong, he burst asunder in the midst, and all his bowels gushed out (Acts 1:18).
BibleWord.ScriptureReference: Job 32:19, Proverbs 3:10, Isaiah 30:14, Jeremiah 2:20, Jeremiah 5:5, Jeremiah 30:8, Nahum 1:13, Mark 2:22, Luke 5:37, Acts 1:18

ClassAssociates.Commentary: Naked. Wake-up Orientation: Feets 0% keyboard error. Daniel 11:17, Daniel 11:37, Acts 11:27-28, (Acts 21:9-11) user interface (UI) error. Record shower butterfly, garage noise...
